---
category: news
title: "No Link Between Grit and Cognitive Ability"
excerpt: "While people with more ‘grit’ may have more self-control, they may not have greater cognitive ability. The corresponding study was published in PLOS ONE. ‘Grit’ may be defined as perseverance when pursuing long-term goals even when difficulties arise."
